text: Differential monocyte adhesion and adhesion molecule expression in venous and arterial endothelial cells .

We compared U-937 cell adhesion and adhesion molecule expression in human umbilical venous ( HUVECs ) and arterial ( HUAECs ) endothelial cells exposed to tumor necrosis factor ( TNF ) , interleukin-1 , and lipopolysaccharide ( LPS ) .

TNF and LPS stimulated <extra_id_0> vascular cell adhesion molecule (VCAM)-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> surface expression and adhesion of U-937 monocyte-like cells to HUVECs but not to HUAECs .

text: Electrophoretic mobility shift assays demonstrated no difference in the pattern of TNF - stimulated nuclear factor-kappaB activation between HUVECs and HUAECs .

These studies demonstrate a novel and striking insensitivity of arterial endothelium to the effects of TNF and LPS and indicate a dissociation between the ability of HUAECs to upregulate nuclear factor-kappaB and <extra_id_0> VCAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
